item.title: Mellum Goes Open Source: A Purpose-Built LLM for Developers, Now on Hugging Face
item.description: Mellum doesn‚Äôt try to know everything. It‚Äôs designed to do one thing really well: code completion. We call it a focal model ‚Äì built with purposeful depth and not concerned with chasing breadth. But code completion is just the start. Mellum will grow into a family of focal models, each specialized for different coding tasks [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/ai/2025/04/mellum-goes-open-source-a-purpose-built-llm-for-developers-now-on-hugging-face/

item.title: Jens Oliver Meiert: How WebStorm and AI Assistant Fit Right Into My Workflow
item.description: For more than two decades, Jens Oliver Meiert has been at the forefront of web development, working with industry giants like Google and Miro, as well as leading engineering teams across various companies. With extensive experience in frontend development, he has witnessed firsthand how tools and workflows have evolved over time. item.title: JetBrains AI Assistant: Smarter, More Capable, and a New Free Tier
item.description: This release introduces major enhancements to boost productivity and reduce repetitive work. Updates include smarter code completion, support for new cloud models like OpenAI GPT-4.1, Claude 3.7 Sonnet, and Gemini 2.5 Pro, advanced RAG-based context awareness, and a new edit mode for multi-file edits directly from the chat. Plus, our revamped subscription model includes both [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/ai/2025/04/jetbrains-ai-assistant-2025-1/

item.title: How to Use Kotlin Notebooks for Productive Development
item.description: Kotlin Notebook is a new interactive environment for JVM developers. This article will cover the main Notebook features and how you can utilize them to improve your productivity.¬†How to use Kotlin Notebook Kotlin Notebook is bundled with IntelliJ IDEA starting from the 2025.1 release, and it is easier than ever to start working with [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/idea/2025/04/how-to-use-kotlin-notebooks-for-productive-development/
